questions.text: A 7 year old child has been complaining of right continuous offensive ear discharge for the last 3 years. A month ago he began to suffer from headache, fever and some vomiting for which he received symptomatic treatment. The patient’s condition was stable for a while, then after 2 weeks he started to suffer from severe headache and drowsiness. The patient also noticed difficulty going up and down the stairs. A week later, he developed weakness in the left arm and left leg, and became markedly drowsy. He became comatose the next day.Choose the most inappropriate statement in context of diagnosis:

options.label: A
options.text: Difficulty in going up and down the stairs is due to hemiparesis

options.label: B
options.text: Canal wall down mastioidectomy is the required remove the cholesteatoma from the ear

options.label: C
options.text: Lumbar puncture should be done to diagnose underlying cause.

options.label: D
options.text: Antibiotics that cross the blood brain barrier should be next step.

questions.correct_answer: C. Lumbar puncture should be done to diagnose underlying cause.

questions.text: A 1 day old child presented with respiratory distress and cyanosis which improves on crying. An endoscopy of nose as done and following endoscopic picture with CT slice is obtained. Choose the most inappropriate statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Occur due to persistence of bucconasal membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Bilateral usually presents with respiratory difficulties

options.label: C
options.text: Failure to pass catheter from nose to pharynx

questions.text: The most likely symptom and laryngeal examination finding in a case of unilateral superior laryngeal nerve palsy are given below. Which is the correct combination:

options.label: A
options.text: Aphonia; vocal cord in cadaveric position

options.label: B
options.text: Weak voice and mild aspiration; bowing of affected vocal cord

options.label: C
options.text: Severe aspiration without voice change; fully mobile vocal cords

options.label: D
options.text: Asymptomatic; posterior commissure deviation to normal side

questions.correct_answer: B. Weak voice and mild aspiration; bowing of affected vocal cord

questions.text: A 25 year old male presented to the ENT emergency room with severe right side throat pain,inability to swallow, accompanied by right earache of 2 days duration. The patient was unable to open his mouth and was feverish 40 C. On examination there was a tender swelling at the angle of the mandible. The patient gave a history of sore throat and fever 39 C during the last week.Choose the most appropriate diagnosis:

A 5 year old boy developed change of his voice that was followed by stridor. The stridor was severe enough to necessitate a tracheostomy. 2 years later the tracheostomy site was not fit for respiration, another tracheostomy was done at a lower level. A reddish tissue that was polypoid in nature filled the tracheostomes. The child died a year later when his tracheostomy tube became obstructed at home. Choose the most appropriate diagnosis

Which of the following is not applicable to Otosclerosis? A. Dip at 2000 Hz in Bone conduction curve B. Worsening of hearing loss during pregnancy C. Schwartz sign in early stage of disease D. Diplacusis E. Roll over phenomena

32 years old male patient was referred from a Neurosurgeon for otological evaluation. The patient had a motor car accident 2 days before. He gave a history of loss of consciousness for a few minutes together with bleeding from the right ear. The patient stated that he could not move the right side of his face since the recovery of consciousness. On examination, blood clots were found in the right external auditory meatus, ecchymosis of the right tympanic membrane and a central posterior perforation with irregular edges could be seen. Tuning fork examination revealed Rinne test was negative in the right ear and positive in the left ear. Weber test was lateralized to the right ear. The patient could not close the right eye or move the right angle of his mouth. Choose the most inappropriate statement regarding diagnosis:

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence of ear bleeding is common in such fractures.

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence of facial palsy is common in such fractures.

options.label: C
options.text: Incidence of csf otorrhoea is common in such fractures.

options.label: D
options.text: Incidence of conductive deafness is common in such fractures.

questions.correct_answer: B. Incidence of facial palsy is common in such fractures.

questions.text: 60-year-old male had been suffering from hoarseness for approximately 5 years. Over the last month, he had been suffering from dyspnea on exertion and, in the last few days even when at rest.The patient also suffered from hypertension, chronic atrial fibrillation, emphysema and chronical bronchitis; despite these problems, he managed a mixed farm with crops and livestock.On examination, he was found to have a painless soft mass at the right side of the neck, about 5 cm in size, conducting vibration during speech, manually reducible, covered with normal skin (Fig)

27 year old female patient presented with painful and difficulty swallowing, on indirect laryngoscopy, there is pooling of saliva in right pyriform sinus with swollen right arytenoid, the most likely diagnosis is:

options.label: B
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma of pyriform sinus.

options.label: C
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma of posterior pharyngeal wall.

questions.correct_answer: D. Squamous cell carcinoma of Postcricoid.

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Faucial Tonsil”? A. Contains 20 crypts. B. Palatoglossus lies anterior to the tonsil. C. The tonsil is supplied by the tonsillar artery, a branch of the facial artery. D. The internal carotid artery lies 2.5cm behind and lateral to the tonsil. E. The main blood supply of the tonsil is from the tonsillar branch of the maxillary artery

A 13 year old boy presents to Ortho OPD with Pain and Swelling around knee. He often localises pain to the anterior part and complains of an exaggerated pain while kneeling down to tie his shoe lace . The mother reveals history of excess and undue running by the boy since his father is very aspirational for him to excel in sports. On examination , there is pain on resisted extension of the knee. His clinico radiological picture is shown below :

A 31 year old female presents with diffuse bone pains and polyarthralgia for last 2 months. She has developed low back pain as well since last one week. Her gait has been altered since last 2 days and she feels excess weakness in getting up from a low seated chair. Her blood Profile is as follows : Serum Calcium LOW , serum Phosphate LOW , Serum ALP HIGH and Vit D Levels LOW. Her Xrays of Spine were done which are as follows :
All of the following statements are TRUE , except :

options.label: A
options.text: Kyphoplasty incorporates injection of PMMA ( Polymethylene methacrylate ) into the collapsed vertebral body via balloon technique

options.label: B
options.text: Kyphoplasty is safe and superior to Vertebroplasty since there are less chances of extravasation of cement in the former technique

options.label: C
options.text: Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

options.label: D
options.text: Cement induced vertebral height inflation corrects not only the posture but also helps in relieving the bone pains

questions.correct_answer: C. Cementing whether vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty can be done in tubercular disease process induced collapsed vertebral bodies

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct answer ?
Maxpage Surgery is :

options.label: A
options.text: Distal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

options.label: B
options.text: Proximal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

options.label: C
options.text: Distal Sliding of Common Extensor Origin

options.label: D
options.text: Proximal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

questions.correct_answer: A. Distal Sliding of Common Flexor Origin

questions.text: What is the angle subtended by the largest letter in the Snellen chart on a person’s eye who is reading it from a distance of 6 meters :
Phenol red thread test is used for dry eye . This test:

options.label: B
options.text: Volume of tears is measured as it changes color on contact with tears

options.label: C
options.text: If the color changes to blue it depicts surface mucin deficiency

options.label: D
options.text: Requires pH meter for reading the result

questions.correct_answer: B. Volume of tears is measured as it changes color on contact with tears

questions.text: Pseudopapillitis is characterised by all except:
Corneal endothelium ion exchange pumps are inhibited by
All are true regarding sarcoidosis except:
questions.correct_answer: D. It leads to nongranulomatous panuveitis

questions.text: A 33 years old male patient complains of pain and watering in the right eye. On examination, a corneal ulcer is seen with elevated margins, feathery hyphae and hypopyon. Which of the following drugs would be effective in him?
Which of the following is a wrong statement:
questions.correct_answer: D. Phylctenular keratoconjunctivitis : Type 1 hypersensitivity reaction

questions.text: Which of the following ,would you not expect to find in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Ipsilateral diffuse,cavernous hemangioma of the choroid.

questions.text: The lateral Geniculate body a/e :

options.label: B
options.text: Contains large M cells in layer 1,2

options.label: C
options.text: Contains axons from the contralateral eye that synapse in layers 2,3 ,5

options.label: D
options.text: Contains small p cells in layers 3-6

questions.correct_answer: C. Contains axons from the contralateral eye that synapse in layers 2,3 ,5

questions.text: Dissociated Vertical deviation a/e

options.label: A
options.text: Manifests with upward deviation of one eye.

options.label: C
options.text: It is consistent with the Herings law

options.label: D
options.text: It is usually asymmetric between two eyes.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is consistent with the Herings law

questions.text: A 25-year-old mid field football player suddenly collapses on the field. He was immediately resuscitated in the emergency room. Further imaging shows a banana shaped left ventricle with hypertrophy of ventricular wall and the septum. which of the following would have led to his sudden collapse during the game?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased demand from the myocardium due to exercise

options.label: B
options.text: Reduced filling of ventricle due to exercise

options.label: C
options.text: Increased obstruction in the outflow track due to reduced filling

questions.text: A 10-year child is having repeated bouts of pneumonia for the last 6 years. he is in 3rd percentile for height and weight. He also complains of increased stool frequency. Stool examination shows fat droplets. Blood examination shows blood sugar of 170mg/dL. Chest imaging shows dilated bronchi. The pediatrician is now suspecting a genetic disease in the child. Which of the following pathogenesis is most likely responsible for the child’s manifestation?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased absorption of iron due to HJV mutation

options.label: B
options.text: An impaired transport of sodium and chloride across the cells

questions.correct_answer: B. An impaired transport of sodium and chloride across the cells

questions.text: A first-year internal medicine resident is doing a retrospective study on immune complex and ANCA mediated glomerulonephritis. He starts to look for various diseases from the archives of patients’ case files to include in his study. Which of the following diagnosis should not be included in his study?

A 42-year-old mother of 4 children presents with dysfunctional uterine bleeding for the last 1 year. Imaging shows multiple fibroids blood examination shows hemoglobin of 5gm/dL. The gynecologist decides to operate her so she receives 3 units of whole blood transfusion with a gap of 4 hours between each transfusion. During the 3rd transfusion she develops severe breathlessness, the blood pressure is 120/80mm of Hg. Chest auscultation shows bilateral basal crepitations. O2 saturation is 89%. She immediately gets inhalational oxygen and bronchodilators. Which of the following additional treatment will help in managing her condition?
questions.correct_answer: D. No further management is required

questions.text: A 5-year child presents with palpable purpura and reduced urine output. Peripheral blood examination is as given in the image. Hb is 11 gm/dL, Platelet count 1.5 lakhs, WBC 7000. Which of the following is likely pathogenesis is leading to such a manifestation in the patient?

A 45-year male is having dyspepsia for the last 7 years. During investigation for the same the physician notes there is a submucosal neoplastic lesion in the stomach, no ulceration or mass into the lumen. A biopsy from the lesion shows small round cells which were positive for CD45, CD20 and negative for CK, CD34, CD117, CD5 and CD23. The KI 67 index is low. which of the following would be appropriate treatment in this patient?

A 4-year boy presents with a testicular mass. An excision was performed and the histological examination shows spindle cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm which of the following marker is likely to be positive in the tumor cells?

A 56-year-old male presents with high grade fever and generalized lymphadenopathy. The size of the lymph nodes varied from 2-3 cm. A biopsy confirmed the diagnosis of NHL. The patient was put on CHOP regimen. After completing the chemotherapy, the size of lymph node has regressed significantly. A biopsy from the regressed lymph nodes is likely to show?

options.label: A
options.text: Maintained cellular outlines with loss of nuclei

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of cellular outline with dense neutrophilic infiltrate.

questions.correct_answer: B. Shrunken cell with nuclear fragmentation

questions.text: A study on etio-pathogenesis in Burkitt lymphoma was carried out in African children. It was identified that most of the children with Burkitt lymphoma were positive for a protein EBNA (Epstein Barr nuclear antigen) which of the following is the mechanism of tumorogenesis by EBNA in these patients?

options.label: A
options.text: Activation of CD 40 on B Cells

options.label: B
options.text: Activation of BCL2 on B cells

options.label: C
options.text: Activation of cyclin D on B cells

options.label: D
options.text: Proteolysis of p53 in B Cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Activation of cyclin D on B cells

questions.text: A 10-year child presents with easy fatigue. His blood examination was suggestive of microcytic hypochromic anemia. He was prescribed with oral iron preparations. 2 months later the child is still having persistent anemia. This time a stool examination was performed and it shows presence of occult blood. Colonoscopy shows few polyps. Oral examination of the child is as follows which was missed on initial presentation. Which of the following is not true about the condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Hamartomoatous polyps can be seen in intestine

options.label: C
options.text: Increased risk of adenocarcinoma of intestine

options.label: D
options.text: Children are usually born with one mutated allele

questions.text: A 55-year old male is on treatment for diabetes and hypertension for last 5 years. the physician now decides to add Aspirin 75 mg to his medication list. Addition of aspirin will prevent which of the following complication in this patient?

A 25-year-old man had a bee sting. Immediately he develops breathlessness, swelling of lips for which he was treated successfully in an emergency. Which of the following cell is responsible for his manifestation?

A 5-year child sustained bilateral femoral fracture for which his legs were immobilized for 42 days. Once the cast was removed the child complained of pain in the calf region for which the mother gave an oil massage at home. 30 minutes later the child has severe breathlessness and was brought to emergency. Which of the following disease you are suspecting in this child?
Histological examination of a CNS tumor shows chicken wire capillaries as shown in the image which of the following tumor is it most likely to be?

A 38-year female presents with a 2 cm nodule in the left breast. The mass is well circumscribed firm and mobile on palpation. The overlying skin is normal and no lymph nodes were palpable. The surgeon decides to go for a lumpectomy. The histological examination is shows in the image. Which of the following is true about this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: It is Low grade low stage ductal carcinoma so no chemo therapy is required

options.label: B
options.text: ER, PR and Her 2 Neu protein analysis should be done to decide adjuvant chemotherapy

options.label: C
options.text: A sentinel node examination should have been performed

questions.correct_answer: D. No further treatment is required

questions.text: A 64-year-old man was seen by his physician for a hard based ulcer on the tip of the tongue. Which group of nodes should be examined by the physician for possible evidence of metastases?

A 66 yrs old man presented with some complaints to oral surgeon. On proper evaluation, submandibular gland excision was planned. He was informed about the possible complications and risks. Structures least likely to be injured in this surgery is:

options.label: D
options.text: Marginal mandibular branch of facial nerve

questions.text: A 22-year-old marathon runner is admitted to the emergency department with severe dyspnea. Physical examination reveals that the patient is experiencing an acute asthma attack, and a bronchodilating drug is administered. Which of the following elements of the nervous system must be inhibited by the drug to achieve relaxation of the smooth muscle of the tracheobronchial tree?
The arterial blood supply to the stomach is derived from all of the following except :
Atrophy of intrinsic muscles of hand, sensory deficit on medial side of forearm and hand, and diminished radial pulse on turning the head on the affected side could be because of :

A 29-year-old woman was involved in an automobile accident. Her car skidded into a tree & she was thrown forward, striking her right knee on the dashboard. At examination in the emergency department, she was found to have a posterior fracture dis location of her right hip joint. What bone or bones got fractured?

options.label: A
options.text: The greater tuberosity of the femur

options.label: C
options.text: The posterior rim of the acetabulum and fracture of the femoral head

options.label: D
options.text: The lesser trochanter of the femur

questions.correct_answer: C. The posterior rim of the acetabulum and fracture of the femoral head

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman comes to the physician complaining of fever, .dysuria, and ?ank pain for three days duration. She is not using vaginal tampons. Her temperature is 37.8 C, blood pressure is 122/78 mm Hg, and pulse is 84/min. Physical examination elicits suprapubic and costovertebral angle tenderness. Urine dipstick analysis reveals positive leukocyte esterase and nitrite. A subsequent urine culture grows colonies of motile Gram-negative rods demonstrating a specific colony morphology on eosin methylene blue (EMB) agar as shown in the image and hemolysis on blood agar. Which of the following is the most important bacterial factor responsible for this patient's condition?

A 12-year-old girl presents to the pediatric dermatologist with an expanding, but otherwise asymptomatic erythematous patch on her right shoulder, which she ?rst noticed 3 days ago. The girl states the rash started as a small red bump but has gradually progressed to its current size. No similar lesions were observed elsewhere by her or her mother. She has felt ill and her mother has detected intermittent low-grade fevers. During the skin examination, a target—like erythematous patch, approximately 7 cm in diameter, was noted on the left shoulder as shown in the image. Another notable ?nding was axillary lymphadenopathy. On further questioning it was revealed that the patient went camping with her a grandfather approximately 11 days ago; however, she does not recall any insect bites or exposure to animals. The family has a pet cat living in their household. Based on the history and physical examination results, what is the most likely drug of choice for this condition?

A 64-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of abrupt-onset fever, malaise, and myalgia. He has also had nasal discharge, sore throat, and a nonproductive cough. The patient has a history of hypertension and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. He is a former smoker but does not use alcohol or illicit drugs. Temperature is 38.3 C, blood pressure is 130/70 mm Hg, pulse is 96/min, and respirations are 18/min. Physical examination shows watery nasal discharge, pharyngeal erythema, and clear lungs on auscultation. Droplet precautions are immediately instituted to prevent spread of the infection. Hand hygiene with an alcohol-based disinfectant following patient contact is also initiated. This patient's infecting pathogen is likely susceptible to the disinfectant due to the presence of which of the following characteristics?

The in?uenza A virus uses a sialic acid as a receptor for cellular entry. The chemical composition of the speci?c type of sialic acid that the vims interacts with differs among animal species. The avian in?uenza virus attaches to a speci?c sialic acid that is present in fowl epithelial cells but absent in human cells, whereas the human in?uenza virus can only attach to the type of sialic acid present in human respiratory epithelium. When pig epithelial cells, which contain both types of sialic acid, are infected with the combination of avian and human influenza A viruses, some of the new avian in?uenza viral particles become capable of attaching to human cells. However, the progeny of this new strain of avian in?uenza virus is still unable to attach to human epithelial cells. Which of the following phenomena best describes the change in the avian in?uenza virus in this experiment?

A 45-year-old Non residential Indian woman residing in USA comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of fever, chills, malaise, and fatigue. The patient returned from an African jungle safari 3 weeks ago. She received me?oquine chemoprophylaxis during the travel, which she stopped taking upon arrival in India. Temperature is 38.9 C, blood pressure is 122/68 mm Hg, pulse is 110/min, and respirations are 20/min. Physical examination shows mucosal pallor. Laboratory results reveal mild anemia and thrombocytopenia. Peripheral blood smear shown in the image revealed the pathogen. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's infection?

options.label: B
options.text: Infection with parasites resistant to chloroquine

options.label: C
options.text: Mosquito bite after discontinuation of prophylaxis

questions.correct_answer: D. Impaired clearance of liver schizonts

questions.text: A 26-year-old man comes to the clinic due to a 3-day-history of dysuria and urethral discharge. The symptoms developed about 2 weeks after he had unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner. His temperature is 37.1 C. he is diabetic for the past 5 years and under medication. On physical examination, a mucoid discharge is expressed with gentle milking of the penis. He Gram stain of the discharge reveals numerous neutrophils with intracellular diplococci. The physician ordered culture and sensitivity. The sample of the discharge is placed on an antibiotic-containing medium, and bacterial colonies are cultured. Which of the following terms best describes the medium?

A 30-year-old man is admitted to the intensive care unit after his wife found him unconscious at home. She says that he has lost a signi?cant amount of weight recently despite no signi?cant change in dietary habits and recently recovered from COVID19. He was vaccinated for COVID19. His mucus membranes are extremely dry. Treatment is initiated, and the patient's condition improves. However, he now has fever, headache, and eye pain. Examination of the nasal cavity shows a black necrotic eschar adherent to the inferior turbinate. Which of the following procedures would most likely reveal the pathogen responsible for this patient's infection?

A 44-year-old man presents to a clinic for evaluation of difficulty swallowing for the past few days. He says that he has noticed progressively worsening chest pain when he attempts to swallow solids or liquids. He works from a home of?ce. has not had any recent sick contacts and is not currently sexually active. His medical history includes acquired immunode?ciency syndrome. His current medications include emtricitabine. rilpivirine. and tenofovir. The temperature is 38 .1"C, the pulse is 72f min, respirations are 18/min, and the blood pressure is 136/84 mm Hg. The physical examination is notable for a dry mouth with red mucosa and no distinct plaques or patches, and a supple neck with no masses or cervical lymphadenopathy. An esophagogastroduodenoscopy shows small white patches within the esophageal lumen. A biopsy of one of the lesions is performed and the microscopic appearance of the ?nding is shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-month-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents due to irritability and white patches in his mouth. His past medical history is signi?cant for 3 episodes of otitis media and 2 episodes of bronchiolitis that have required hospitalization. He also has a history of chronic loose stools. The child is small for his age and ill-appearing. Head and neck examination shows white patches consistent with oral candidiasis but is otherwise normal. Auscultation of the lungs shows expiratory wheezing. Cardiac examination is within normal limits. Laboratory results are as follows: Sodium 140 mEqIL/ L, Potassium 3.8 mqL, Chloride 98 mEq/L ,Bicarbonate 24 mqL Calcium 9.6 mg/dL .Serum protein electrophoresis shows a very low gamma globulin level. Chest x-ray reveals an absent thymic shadow. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 72-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department from a nursing facility due to fever, chills, and hypotension. The patient has a history of diabetes mellitus, ischemic stroke, and neurogenic bladder. She has an indwelling urinary catheter. Temperature is 38.8 C (102 F), blood pressure is 80/40 mm Hg, and pulse is 130imin. The patient is lethargic and disoriented. Her extremities are warm, and her breathing is rapid and shallow. Lungs are clear on auscultation and there are no heart murmurs. There is left costovertebral angle tenderness. The urine in her catheter appears cloudy. Her leukocyte count is elevated with left shift, and urinalysis shows pyuria and bacteriuria. Which of the following chemical mediators is most responsible for this patient's current condition?
Best noninvasive investigation to check for viability of myocardium is
Expansion of the contrast filled space in myelography is seen in
Non-visualization of gallbladder in hepatic scintigraphy is suggestive of:
questions.correct_answer: C. Acute cholecystitis due to gallstones

questions.text: Which of the following doesn’t use ionizing radiation?
Empty thecal sac sign is seen in?

A 30-year-old man was brought to the Accident and Emergency Department. He suddenly fell down after hearing a loud sound at a party. There was no loss of consciousness. The psychopathology being described is:

A 60-year-old woman complained of depression and was started on escitalopram. After two weeks of treatment, she complains of lethargy, muscle weakness and nausea. Which of the following is the most likely cause for her symptoms:

When a 27-year-old patient who had a contentious relationship with his father joins a new health insurance plan, he must change from his primary care physician, a young man, to a new physician, a middle-aged man. On his first visit to the new doctor, the patient seems annoyed with everything the doctor says and states, “You are an old man with old-fashioned ideas; you just want to control my life.” This patient’s behavior is most closely related to which of the following?

Whenever a 46-year-old man visits his physician, his blood pressure is elevated. When the patient takes his own blood pressure at home, it is usually normal. The doctor says that while other tests need to be done, the patient is probably showing “white-coat hypertension.” For this scenario, the patient’s blood pressure in the doctor’s office represents

A 50-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by ambulance. His respirations are shallow and infrequent, his pupils are constricted, and he is stuporous. He was noted to have suffered a grand mal seizure in the ambulance. Which of the following drugs is this man most likely to have overdosed on?
In which of the following diseases, administration of dapsone is used as a therapeutic test?
Young girl present with extensive pruritus since 3 years with lichenification & creases below the eyes. The likely diagnosis is
Melanocytes are normal in number in

A previously healthy 5-year-old boy is seen in the ED with a 1-day history of low-grade fever, colicky abdominal pain, and a rash. His mother reports no vomiting, diarrhea, sick contacts, recent illnesses or change in behavior. He has had no previous serious illnesses and takes no medications. His immunizations are current. On physical examination he has a temperature of 38°C (100.5F), a heart rate of 101 beats per minute, a respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and a blood pressure of 100/58 mm Hg. He is awake, alert, active, and in no distress. The skin has diffuse erythematous maculopapular and petechial lesions on the buttocks and lower extremities (Photograph). Laboratory data demonstrate:

A 50-hour-old neonate develops twitching and tremors of the extremities. The neonate was born at term by cesarean section to a 26-year-old primigravida mother with insulin-dependent gestational diabetes. Birth weight was 4500 g (9 Ib, 14.5 oz). The newborn’s initial glucose at 1 hour of age was 25 mg/dL, but after breast-feeding subsequent glucoses have all been above 60 mg/dL. On physical examination the temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), heart rate is 140 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 34 breaths per minute. The newborn is diaphoretic and irritable. The extremities twitch and have tremors. The rest of the examination is normal. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this newborn’s condition?

An 8-year old child is seen for a routine well-child visit. The mother reports the child has been in good health with seasonal allergies for which he takes over-the-counter loratadine. He is active in sports and does well in school. On physical examination the temperature is 37°C (98.5°F), heart rate is 85 beats per minute, respiratory rate is 22 breaths per minute, and blood pressure is 105/70 mm Hg. Height has a loud S1 and a fixed, widely split S2. A grade II/VI midsystolic ejection murmur is present in the second intercostals space along the left sterna border. Abdomen is soft, nontender, and without hepatosplenomegaly. Extremities show no clubbing or cyanosis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old presents to your office for puffy eyes. Her past history is significant for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) for which she takes a stimulant medicine, and an upper respiratory tract infection that resolved the previous week. Her blood pressure is 97/57 mm Hg. heart rate is 90 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 18 breaths per minute. A careful physical examination is otherwise normal. You obtain a urinalysis that reveals 4+ protein, without leukocytes or blood, and her serum creatinine is 0.2 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Nephrotic syndrome due to minimal change disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Nephrotic syndrome due to minimal change disease

questions.text: You are asked to evaluate a term infant born to a mother with significant alcohol intake during the pregnancy. In addition to counseling the mother about potential adverse neurodevelopmental consequences in the infant, you discuss the physical examination features suggestive of fetal alcohol syndrome. All of the following physical examination findings can be associated with intrauterine alcohol exposure EXCEPT:

options.label: E
options.text: Thin vermillion border of the upper lip

questions.text: Which of the following series of maternal serum screening test results (alpha-fetoprotein=AFP; human chorionic gonadotrophin=hCG; unconjugated estriol=uE3) is the correct chemical signature for a fetus at high risk for trisomy 21?

options.label: A
options.text: High AFP, high beta-hCG, low uE3, high inhibin A

options.label: B
options.text: High AFP, low beta-hCG, low uE3, low inhibin A

options.label: C
options.text: Low AFP, high beta-hCG, low uE3, high inhibin A

options.label: D
options.text: Low AFP, low beta-hCG, low uE3, low inhibin A

questions.correct_answer: C. Low AFP, high beta-hCG, low uE3, high inhibin A

questions.text: A woman with bipolar disorder seeks obstetric care during her second trimester. When obtaining her history, the obstetrician learns that she has been taking lithium daily. Prenatal counseling of this woman should include a discussion that maternal lithium use can lead to what potential teratogenic effect on a fetus?

A pregnant woman initially presents for prenatal care at 28 weeks’ gestation. Upon review of her history, she reports systemic hypertension in her past medical history and medication use of captopril throughout her pregnancy. You counsel her on the potential teratogenic effects of captopril. Of the following, the most likely fetal risk associated with maternal captopril is:

You are called to the delivery of a term infant. The obstetrical nurse informs you that the maternal medications include magnesium for pregnancy-induced hypertension. The infant emerges with no spontaneous cry. After 30 seconds of drying and stimulation, the infant has a heart rate of 100 beats per minute but does not have any respiratory effort. You initiate positive-pressure ventilation (PPV) by bag-mask ventilation. You do not appreciate any chest movement or auscultate any aeration with PPV. The infant’s heart rate decreases to 70 beats per minute. The most appropriate NEXT STEP for the baby in this vignette is to:

options.label: E
options.text: Readjust the mask being used for PPV

questions.correct_answer: E. Readjust the mask being used for PPV

questions.text: You are called to the delivery room to evaluate a full-term male infant who has just been born by vaginal birth. You observe that the infant is in severe respiratory distress without breath sounds on the left side. The infant’s abdomen is scaphoid in appearance. What is the most appropriate initial management of this infant?

options.label: A
options.text: Insert a chest tube to evacuate air from the pleural space

options.label: B
options.text: Intubate the infant and minimize inflation pressure to achieve gentle ventilation

options.label: C
options.text: Place an umbilical venous line and start intravenous prostaglandin

options.label: D
options.text: Provide bag-mask ventilation with high positive inspiratory pressure to reinflate the collapsed lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Intubate the infant and minimize inflation pressure to achieve gentle ventilation

questions.text: An autopsy was performed on a case of accidental death. It showed two linear fractures on petrous part of temporal bone. Which of the following rules gives the sequence of fractures?
According to transplantation of human organs Act, which of the following doctors are not authorized to declare brainstem death:

options.label: A
options.text: RMP in charge of the hospital

questions.text: A 3 year old child presented to the OPD with the symptom of influenza. Aspirin is contraindicated in this patient because of increased risk of :
Dapsone is used for treatment of bacterial and fungal infections as well as for immunomodulatory actions. What is mechanism of dapsone for these indications?

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of ergosterol in cell membranes

options.label: D
options.text: Competition with PABA in folic acid synthesis

questions.correct_answer: D. Competition with PABA in folic acid synthesis

questions.text: Paediatrician was called for attending a new born baby. The serum unconjugated bilirubin of this baby was 33 mg/dL. Which of the following drug taken by mother in late 3rd trimester may have lead to this problem?

A young female is on anti- epileptic drugs since 6 months. She had no episode of seizure after starting the drug therapy. EEG and Brain CT scan is normal. What should be the further management of this girl?

options.label: B
options.text: Continue the treatment of minimum 2 years

options.label: D
options.text: Stop treatment and follow up with regular EEG monitoring

questions.correct_answer: B. Continue the treatment of minimum 2 years

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the mechanism of action of thyroid hormones T4 and T3 at thyroid hormone receptor?

options.label: B
options.text: These act by increasing cyclic AMP

options.label: C
options.text: These activate a tyrosine kinase enzyme

options.label: D
options.text: These activate a nuclear transcription factor

questions.correct_answer: D. These activate a nuclear transcription factor

questions.text: A 50 year old man, who had a recent history of valve replacement surgery in on anticoagulants and develops the below lesion. Which of the following is responsible for the same?
A 30 yr. old pregnant woman develops tuberculosis. Which of the following anti-tubercular drugs should not be used –

Anti-Platelet therapy is usually given for patients with stroke, MI and peripheral vascular disease. PPIs are frequently administered along with these drugs to prevent the risk of increased gastrointestinal erosions and bleeding. The interaction between clopidogrel and PPI has recently been given much attention due to its clinical significance. The metabolizing enzyme common to these two drugs is –
A baby is identified with PDA in his first week of life. Which of the following medications will be useful in his treatment?

Some gram negative bacteria produce an enzyme that blocks the action of beta lactam antibiotic in periplasmic space. which arrow in the structural diagram of penicillin denotes the site of action of this enzyme: (Colorfig.6)

In a village with a population of 5000, the infant mortality rate is 100 and the birth rate as 30. Calculate the number of doses of measles vaccine required for the number of eligible children in the village, if the wastage factor of measles vaccine is two:

A new triage system was set up in an emergency unit of general hospital. To evaluate the new system, the waiting time of patients was measured and compared with the waiting time at a comparable nearby hospital for a period of 6 months. The type of study (research design) in above mentioned example is:

You have just finished conducting a case-control study to measure the association between alcohol use and lower respiratory tract infections. The most appropriate method to control for smoking as a confounder is
Consider the following two distribution curves. Which numerical summary measure would allow you to discriminate between the two distributions?
A prospective cohort study examining the association between passive smoking and cervical cancer reveals an odd ratio of 1.3 (95% confidence interval 0.85- 6). The most appropriate conclusion is that

options.label: A
options.text: There is a significant association between passive smoking and cervical cancer

options.label: D
options.text: A 90% confidence interval would result in a narrower confidence interval

questions.correct_answer: D. A 90% confidence interval would result in a narrower confidence interval

questions.text: A hypothetical study examining the association between serum cholesterol (> 280) and cardiovascular disease (CVD) demonstrates a crude relative risk of 3.0. When the data is stratified by gender, the relative risk for men is 4.0 and the relative risk for women is 1.0. The adjusted risk is 3.0. The, most appropriate interpretation of the results of this study is that

options.label: A
options.text: Gender is both a confounder and an effect modifier

options.label: C
options.text: Gender is an effect modifier only

options.label: D
options.text: Gender is neither a confounder nor an effect modifier

questions.correct_answer: C. Gender is an effect modifier only

questions.text: A clinical training program wishes to evaluate the reliability of self-assessment of clinical skills as a tool for measuring improvement. After a teaching session, students are asked to rank themselves (on a scale of 1 to 5) on 10 examination procedures. The preceptor also ranks the students according to the same scale. The results of the two assessments are then compared. The most appropriate test statistic to compare results is
Which insect amongst following has not developed resistance to DDT?
Point prevalence studies tend to overestimate the occurrence of which of the following diseases?
questions.correct_answer: B. Diseases with a long duration

questions.text: Interview used to study the social & psychological effects of mass communication is:
Numerator for calculating Perinatal mortality rate is:

options.label: A
options.text: All infant deaths less than or equal to 7 days of age

options.label: B
options.text: All infant deaths less than or equal to 28 days of age

options.label: C
options.text: All infant deaths less than or equal to 1 year of age

options.label: D
options.text: All infant deaths between 28 days to 1 year of age

questions.correct_answer: A. All infant deaths less than or equal to 7 days of age

questions.text: Human development index includes all of the following except:
With reference to meningococcal meningitis, which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Fatality in untreated cases is 90 percent

options.label: B
options.text: Disease spreads mainly by droplet infection epidemiological pattern of disease

options.label: C
options.text: Mass chemoprophylaxis causes immediate drop in the incidence rate of cases.

options.label: D
options.text: Geographic distribution and epidemic capabilities differ according to the serogroup.

questions.correct_answer: A. Fatality in untreated cases is 90 percent

questions.text: A freshly prepared oral rehydration solution should not be used after
In a certain population, there were 4050 births in the last one year. There were 50 still births. 50 infants died within 7 days where as 150 died within 28 days. What is the NMR?

A 30 year old man is being opreated for cerebellar tumour in sitting position. during surgery there is sudden fall in ocygen saturation to 50% and ETCO2 becomes zero. Which of the following is least likely to cause this

options.label: A
options.text: Disconnection of circut from anaesthesia machine

questions.text: A 70 year old patient is admitted in emergency with intestinal obstruction. Laprotomy is planned.the patient has serum sodium of 140 meq/L and potassium of 5.2 mmol/L.Rapid intubation can be done with which of the following:

A 4 year old child undergoing strbismus surgery under general anaesthesia suddenly develops sinuus bradycardia and intermittent ventricular escape beats. the blood pressure and saturation are stable. immediate management will be

options.label: A
options.text: Tell surgeon to stop pulling eye muscle

questions.correct_answer: A. Tell surgeon to stop pulling eye muscle

questions.text: A 26 years old, G3P2L2 has come with 12 weeks of gestation. She has frequent vomiting, restlessness and heat intolerance in the last 2 weeks. On examination, her pulse is 114/min with low volume, BP is 100/60 mm Hg, uterus is of 16-week size. USG was done which was suggestive of intrauterine hypoechoic, multiple, 2-3 cm sized vesicles. Which of the following is not correct regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient should undergo suction and evacuation followed by sharp curettage.

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of development of neoplasia after the treatment of this case is 2-5%

options.label: C
options.text: Most common karyotype of the products of conception is 46 XX

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperthyroidism and hyperemesis will subside after suction and evacuation

questions.correct_answer: B. Risk of development of neoplasia after the treatment of this case is 2-5%

questions.text: A 33 years old G3P2L2 with 30 weeks of gestation with previous full term normal deliveries was incidentally diagnosed as a case of short cervix with cervical length of 1.5 cm. There is no other obstetric high risk and clinical examination is within normal limits. Which of the following is a correct treatment plan for this patient?

A 25 years old G2P1L1 has 12 weeks of gestation. Her NT scan report shows 3.8 mm NT. Her DIPSI test is suggestive of value 208mg%. DUAL marker test is within normal limits. Which of the following things should be included in the management of this case?
questions.correct_answer: A. Chorion villous sampling and insulin

questions.text: A 26 years old lady presented with acute onset of breathlessness and fatigue for 5-7 days. She had a full-term normal delivery 1 month back. She had mild pre-eclampsia during antenatal period but her BP was normal after delivery. Her Hb is 11.2gm%. There is no history of any cardio respiratory disease in past. Her chest X ray is normal. Her 2D echo shows LVEF of 35% with no cardiac lesion. Her ECG is within normal limits. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 32 years old Primigravida with 30 weeks of gestation has come with history of easy fatiguability in the last 1-2 months. Her Hb is 7.5gm%, Sr. Ferritin is 10ng/ml, MCV = 70 fl and MCHC is 23%. What should be the appropriate treatment?
questions.correct_answer: B. IFA pills (2 pills per day)

questions.text: Which one of the following cases can be delivered vaginally?

options.label: B
options.text: Face with mentoposterior position in active labour

options.label: D
options.text: Compound presentation with hand and leg felt at internal os

questions.correct_answer: C. Previous 2 LSCS with non-recurrent indications

questions.text: What is the ideal time to vaccinate a patient a patient who has undergone an emergency splenectomy after a road traffic accident?

options.label: D
options.text: Timing does not make a difference

questions.text: During caesarean section, a patient had profuse bleeding due to atonic PPH and unstable vitals . Which one of the following is not a suitable management for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Ligation of anterior division of internal iliac artery

questions.text: What is the management of CBD stone >2.5 cm with dilated CBD and distal stricture following cholecystectomy?
Which one of the following patients should not be treated by surgical management?

options.label: A
options.text: Tubal ectopic with B-HCG of 12000 IU/L

options.label: B
options.text: Carcinoma of cervix limited to cervix and size of 5 cm

options.label: C
options.text: Endometrial cancer stage 1A of 1 cm size

options.label: D
options.text: Fibroid uterus of 16-week size FIGO type 2-5 in an infertile patient

questions.correct_answer: B. Carcinoma of cervix limited to cervix and size of 5 cm

questions.text: Transurethral resection (TUR) syndrome is caused by:

options.label: A
options.text: Absorption of fluid during procedures such as holmium laser enucleation of the prostate (HoLEP) and bipolar TURP.

options.label: B
options.text: Absorption of non–sodium-containing irrigating fluid, leading to an acute dilutional hyponatremia

options.label: C
options.text: Irrigating fluid placed at a less than ideal height above the patient.

options.label: D
options.text: A serum sodium of greater than 130 mEq/L.

questions.correct_answer: B. Absorption of non–sodium-containing irrigating fluid, leading to an acute dilutional hyponatremia

questions.text: A patient with CA penis planned for brachytherapy. Most commonly used isotope for this condition is?

Which one of the following is correct regarding HPV vaccine? i: HPV vaccines are made up of L1 capsid antigen ii: Gardasil-9 is a nonavalent vaccine having antigens of HPV 6,11,16,18,31,33,45,52,58 iii: Age group of Gardasil-9 is 9-26 years iv: 3 doses of Gardasil-9 are given at 0, 2mt and 6 months
Which of the following biochemical marker does not fit into the case of PCOS?

options.label: C
options.text: Low ovarian reserve with decreased Sr. AMH levels

questions.correct_answer: C. Low ovarian reserve with decreased Sr. AMH levels

questions.text: A 62-year-old man is about to undergo an elective abdominoperineal resection for a low rectal carcinoma. He usually takes 5 mg warfarin per day for atrial fibrillation. His most recent international normalized ratio (INR) is 2.9. Which of the following is the best preoperative strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: Admit the patient 1 day prior to surgery to stop warfarin and check the INR

options.label: B
options.text: Admit the patient 3–5 days prior to surgery to stop the warfarin and check the INR < 1.5

options.label: C
options.text: Admit the patient 3–5 days prior to surgery to stop the warfarin, check the INR < 1.5 and start aspirin

options.label: D
options.text: Admit the patient 3–5 days prior to surgery to stop the warfarin,check the INR < 1.5 and start heparin infusion

questions.correct_answer: D. Admit the patient 3–5 days prior to surgery to stop the warfarin,check the INR < 1.5 and start heparin infusion

questions.text: A 32 years old, infertile woman with amenorrhoea has come to the OPD with following investigational reports: Partner’s semen analysis = Within normal range Sr. FSH = 85 IU/L Sr. TSH = 1mIU/L Sr. PRL = 18 ng/ml What should be the plan of management? I. Thyroxine 50 mcg daily II. Bromocriptine 2.5 mg daily III. HRT IV. Ovum donation+ IVF
In a case of primary amenorrhoea, which one of the following is an incorrect statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Swyer syndrome has male genotype with female external genitalia and infantile uterus

options.label: B
options.text: Turner’s syndrome has female phenotype and infantile uterus

options.label: C
options.text: CAH has female genotype with virilised external genitalia

options.label: D
options.text: AIS has male genotype with female external genitalia and female gonads

questions.correct_answer: D. AIS has male genotype with female external genitalia and female gonads

questions.text: You are asked to see a 35-year-old man who sustained a head injury during a road traffic accident. The patient was stable upon arrival to the emergency department, but over the last hour, his GCS has fallen from 15/15 to 13/15 and he is now drowsy and complaining of a headache. From the list below, choose the most appropriate next step to take in this patient's management.

options.label: A
options.text: Repeat the GCS score in an hour

options.label: B
options.text: Speak with the Neurosurgical Registrar on-call with a view to take the patient to theatre

options.label: C
options.text: Request an urgent CT scan of the head

options.label: D
options.text: Prescribe an intravenous infusion of mannitol

questions.correct_answer: C. Request an urgent CT scan of the head

questions.text: A 53 years old post-menopausal patient was having hot flashes in the past 3-4 months. HRT was planned for her but she gave history of DVT 20 years back. Which of the following is not allowed in her? I. EPRT II. Raloxifene III. Paroxitene IV. Clonidine

A 39-year-old patient presents to your office with a left 3.5-cm breast tumor, which on core needle biopsy, is shown to be an invasive ductal cancer. On left axillary examination, she has a hard nonfixed lymph node. A biopsy of a left supraclavicular node is positive for malignancy. Her stage is currently classified as?
Treatment of choice for medullary carcinoma of thyroid is:
Which one of the following is not the step in doing vaginal hysterectomy with enterocoele repair?

options.label: B
options.text: Obliteration of cul-de-sac with uterosacral ligaments

options.label: C
options.text: Ligating and cutting the uterosacral and Mackenrodt’s ligaments

questions.text: Identify the surgical procedure shown below?

A 68 years old postmenopausal patient has 3rd degree UV prolapse with cystocoele of grade 2nd degree. She gives history of postmenopausal bleeding in the last 6 months. Her PAP smear is reported as Negative for intraepithelial lesion or malignancy. Her USG is showing endometrial thickness of 2mm. She is anaesthetically fit for any major surgery. What is the next best line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Do vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy

questions.correct_answer: B. Do vaginal hysterectomy with anterior colporrhaphy

questions.text: All are true about the endocopic picture of the stomach shown below except:

options.label: D
options.text: H. pylori is a predisposing factor in adults

questions.text: A patient’s CT scan reveals diverticulitis confined to the sigmoid colon. There is no associated pericolic abscess. What is best course of treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Bowel rest, nasogastric suction, IV fluids, and broad spectrum antibiotics

questions.correct_answer: A. Bowel rest, nasogastric suction, IV fluids, and broad spectrum antibiotics

questions.text: An elderly patient is brought to the hospital with recent onset of colicky abdominal pain, distension and obstipation on examination. O/E the abdomen is markedly distended and tympanic on percussion. There is no marked tenderness. Plain abdominal x-ray shows a markedly distended loop located mainly in the right upper quadrant. The likely diagnosis is:
Identify the manoeuvre?

A patient had severe retching and vomiting after meals, following which he developed severe retrosternal pain. He was brought to the hospital after 3 days with high grade fever, leucocytosis, shift to left, and hypoxia. Plain X ray revealed Left pleural effusion and “Naclerio V Sign”. Now the best treatment for him is?

options.label: A
options.text: Conservative management with NPO, IV fluids, high grade antibiotics and left ICD

options.label: B
options.text: Conservative management with intubation and put patient on ventilator

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of esophageal tear.

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate surgery and do isolation of esophageal tear by proximal and distal ligation, feeding jejunostomy and cervical esophagostomy.

questions.correct_answer: D. Immediate surgery and do isolation of esophageal tear by proximal and distal ligation, feeding jejunostomy and cervical esophagostomy.

questions.text: A 48-year-old woman presents with thick greenish nipple discharge from left breast with minimal peri-ductal mastitis. Mammogram showed coarse luminal calcification (Picture given below). Best treatment for this patient is?
Match the following:

A 16 years old girl has not yet got her menses. Her secondary sexual characters are Tanner 4 for breast development and Tanner 4 for pubic hair growth. Her height is 50th percentile for her age. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis amongst the given options?

An elderly female who had chronic blood loss anaemia, requiring multiple blood transfusion presented with hematemesis. Upper GI endoscopy showed columns of red tortuous ectatic vessels along longitudinal folds of the antrum of the stomach (Picture given below). For uncotrolled bleeding, best surgical treatment for her should be

options.label: C
options.text: Gastrotomy and ligature of bleeding vessels

questions.text: A 43-year-old man is hit in the face with a base- ball bat and presents to the emergency depart- ment with massive facial swelling, ecchymosis, and an elongated face. There is mobility of the middle third of the face on digital manipulation of the maxilla. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old woman with mild hypertension is admitted for elective hysterectomy. On preoperative evaluation, she is found to have osteoarthritis; over the previous 6 months, she had noted watery diarrhea that was becoming progressively worse. The serum potassium is 3 mEq/L. Which is the most likely cause of hypokalemia?

A 23 years old G2P1L1 with 33 weeks of gestation has undergone USG in view of suspected IUGR. Her AFI is 6 cm, fetal weight is 7th percentile, NST is reactive, there is cephalic presentation with fundal placenta and grade 3 maturity, Her BP is normal. Her Doppler is suggestive of S/D ratio of 4.5 in umbilical artery. Which of the following is the most appropriate management? I: Steroids II: Mgso4 III: Monitor nst and afi twice a week IV: Continue pregnancy V: Induction of labour VI: LSCS

A 68-year-old man undergoes a CT scan of the abdomen as part of the evaluation for some mild abdominal tenderness after a motor vehicle collision. The scan reveals no evidence of trauma, but a 4-cm solid left renal mass is noted. There is evidence of thrombus in the inferior vena cava. Which of the following treatments is not indicated?

options.label: A
options.text: Preoperative chemotherapy and radiation to downstage tumor

options.label: B
options.text: Resection of the left adrenal gland

options.label: C
options.text: Resection of the para-aortic lymph nodes

questions.correct_answer: A. Preoperative chemotherapy and radiation to downstage tumor

questions.text: A middle aged male presented with an episode of hematemesis. He gives single episode of past history of self-limiting attack of hematemesis few days back. Endoscopy showed a jet of blood emanating from a tiny defect in the mucosa without any associated visible ulcer, at the lesser curvature, 2 cm from GE junction. Most probable diagnosis for this case is?
Which of the followings are used in the treatment of endometriosis? I: Elagolix II: Danazol III: Ethinyl estradiol + norgestimate IV: Anastrazole V: Mifepristone
Which of the following is true regarding multifetal gestation?

options.label: A
options.text: Prophylactic cerclage in 2nd trimester prevents preterm labour

options.label: B
options.text: Monochorionic diamniotic twins have high risk of cord entanglement

options.label: C
options.text: Timing of delivery in an uncomplicated DCDA twins is 40 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Prophylactic tocolytics till 34 weeks are not useful to prevent preterm labour

questions.correct_answer: D. Prophylactic tocolytics till 34 weeks are not useful to prevent preterm labour

questions.text: Steriotactic core needle biopsy of mammographic calcification demonstrates sclerosing adenosis associated with the calcification and LCIS not associated with calcifications (an incidental finding). The patient should be treated by?

options.label: B
options.text: Re-excisionto negative margin followed by whole breast irradiation.

options.label: C
options.text: Re-excision to negative margin, sentinel node biopsy and whole breast irradiation.

options.label: D
options.text: Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.correct_answer: D. Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.text: Within the femoral triangle, the femoral vein and artery are encased in a fascial femoral sheath. The medial part of this sheath contains a small, vertical gap – the femoral ring – through which herniation may occur. The boundaries of the femoral ring include all the following except the:
A69-year-old man is informed that the cause of his dysphagis is a benign lesion. The barium swallow is shown in given fig. What should he be told regarding benign tumors and cysts of the eosphagus?

options.label: A
options.text: They occur more commonly than malignant tumors.

options.label: B
options.text: They are symptomatic at an early age.

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnosis is best confirmed on chest x-ray.

options.label: D
options.text: Leiomyoma is the most common benign tumor encountered in the esophagus.

questions.correct_answer: D. Leiomyoma is the most common benign tumor encountered in the esophagus.

questions.text: Putrefaction is delayed in case of poisoning by
A 64-year-old man has symptoms of reflux esophagitis for 20 years. The barium study shown (Fig) demonstrates a sliding hiatal hernia. Whis is TRUE in sliding hiatal hernia?

options.label: B
options.text: The cardia is displaced into the posterior mediatstinum.

questions.correct_answer: B. The cardia is displaced into the posterior mediatstinum.

questions.text: A 40-year-old man with a long history of bloody diarrhea presents with increased abdominal pain, vomiting, and fever. On examination, he is found to be dehydrated and shows tachycardia and hypotension. The abdomen is markedly tender with guarding and rigidity. What is the most likely cause?

options.label: C
options.text: Perforated carcinoma of the sigmoid colon

questions.correct_answer: A. Toxic megacolon in ulcerative colitis

questions.text: An elderly man complained, “My guts are rotten and blood has stopped flowing to my heart. I am dead.” The psychopathology being described is:
Which of the following symptoms of schizophrenia is not a first rank symptom?

A 37-year-old woman is admitted to an inpatient treatment program for withdrawal from heroin. Eighteen hours after her last injection of heroin, she becomes hypertensive, irritable, and restless. She also has nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Which medication would be best to treat some of the autonomic symptoms of opioid withdrawal?
Winking owl sign is seen in:

options.label: C
options.text: Vertebral fracture due to cervical traction

questions.text: Iodine isotope used for radio ablation of thyroid in Graves’ disease is:
Mushroom cap sign in MRI is seen in:
A 56-year-old man with facial and ocular weakness has just been diagnosed with myasthenia gravis. All of the following tests are necessary before instituting therapy EXCEPT:
One litre of normal saline is given to a patient in the emergency department. How is this fluid likely to be distributed between the fluid compartments?

options.label: A
options.text: Intracellular fluid 0mL, extracellular fluid 1000mL, plasma volume 1000mL

options.label: B
options.text: Intracellular fluid 0mL, extracellular fluid 1000mL, plasma volume 200mL

options.label: C
options.text: Intracellular fluid 1000mL, extracellular fluid 0mL, plasma volume 0mL

options.label: D
options.text: Intracellular fluid 500mL, extracellular fluid 500mL, plasma volume 500mL

questions.correct_answer: B. Intracellular fluid 0mL, extracellular fluid 1000mL, plasma volume 200mL

questions.text: A 25 year old female who has chronic hepatitis B and is under long-term follow-up in the hepatology clinic is 27 weeks pregnant, about to enter her third trimester. She is worried she will give her baby hepatitis B and would like you to reassure her. You review her blood tests from this clinic appointment at 27 weeks’ gestation. LFTs: Bilirubin 1.05 mg/dL, ALT 14 U/L ALP 84 U/L.HBsAg positive, HBeAg negative, HBV DNA 48 U/mL (low titre). What is the most appropriate next step in her management plan?
Which of the following scoring systems should be used to identify and prioritise whether alcoholic cirrhosis patient should be assessed for liver transplantation?
questions.correct_answer: C. MELD (Model for End-Stage Liver Disease)

questions.text: Kartagener syndrome has the following features EXCEPT:
Which of the following is considered as significant weight loss?
Which of the following Ascitic Fluid analysis is most compatible with a diagnosis of Ascites? secondary to cirrhosis?

options.label: A
options.text: SAAG < 1.1 g/dl ; Ascitic Fluid Protein < 2.5 g/dl

options.label: B
options.text: SAAG < 1.1 g/dl ; Ascitic Fluid Protein > 2.5 g /dl

options.label: C
options.text: SAAG > 1.1 g/dl ; Ascitic Fluid Protein < 2.5 g /dl

options.label: D
options.text: SAAG > 1.1 g/dl ; Ascitic Fluid Protein > 2.5 g /dl

questions.correct_answer: C. SAAG > 1.1 g/dl ; Ascitic Fluid Protein < 2.5 g /dl

questions.text: All the following are suggestive of protein losing enteropathy except?

options.label: C
options.text: Marked reduction of serum albumin with normal serum globulin

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman complains of aching all over. She sleeps poorly and all her muscles and joints hurt. Her symptoms have progressed over several years. She reports that she is desperate because pain and weakness often cause her to drop things. Physical examination shows multiple points of tenderness over the neck, shoulders, elbows, and wrists. There is no joint swelling or deformity. A complete blood count and ESR are normal. Rheumatoid factor is negative. Which of the following is the best therapeutic option in this patient?
Which type of ca lung causes SIADH most frequently?

A 30-year-old quadriplegic man presents to the emergency room with fever, dyspnea, and cough. He has a chronic indwelling Foley catheter. Recurrent urinary tract infections have been a problem for a number of years. He has been on therapy to suppress the urinary tract infections. On examination, the patient has a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F), HR 88, and BP 126/76. Mild wheezing is audible over both lungs. A diffuse erythematous rash is noted. The chest x-ray shows diffuse alveolar infiltrates. The CBC reveals a WBC of 13,500, with 50% segmented cells, 30% lymphocytes, and 20% eosinophils. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Sepsis with acute respiratory distress syndrome secondary to urinary tract infection

options.label: C
options.text: Drug reaction to one of his medications

questions.correct_answer: C. Drug reaction to one of his medications

questions.text: A 24 year old man is admitted with symptoms of headache, feeling flushed with associated palpitations and sweating. He is hypertensive and a 24-hour urine collection shows elevated metanephrines. First-line treatment for this condition should be with which of the following?

An 18 year old woman is admitted to hospital following a collapse at home. She describes prodromal symptoms of palpitations, weakness and diplopia. Plasma glucose concentration is 40 mg/dL. Plasma samples are taken on admission, showing C-peptide < 2 ng/mL and insulin 25µIU/mL. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 62 year old man is noted to have large hands and prognathism. He complains of headaches of increasing frequency and severity over the preceding 6 months since his last visit to the clinic. Which endocrine investigation should be performed to investigate the cause of his symptoms?

A 58 year old man with type 2 diabetes of 10 years duration and a BMI of 33 kg/m2 has HbA1c of 8.5% on metformin monotherapy 1 g twice daily.Which of the following agent will be appropriate as additional treatment options?
A 65 year old woman with a previous history of diabetes and breast carcinoma is found collapsed at home with drowsiness and a left hemiparesis. Which of the following should be carried out first?

A 67-year-old man presents with fever, headache, and right arm and leg weakness. His symptoms progressed over the preceding 2 days. On physical examination he appears healthy but confused. He has neck rigidity and 4 out of 5 strength in his right arm and leg. Cranial nerve examination is within normal limits. CT head is negative. Lumbar puncture reveals a white blood cell count of 158 with predominance of lymphocytes and 21 red blood cells. Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) glucose level is normal, while CSF protein level is mildly elevated. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 56-year-old woman presents with cough for the past 2 months and streak hemoptysis for the past 3 days. She denies dyspnea on exertion. She has smoked 2 packs of cigarettes a day for the past 35 years. She is otherwise healthy and has not lost weight. Physical examination is normal. Chest x ray reveals a shaggy 3-cm nodule in the right mid-lung field. Transthoracic needle biopsy shows a squamous cell carcinoma.What will be the most important metabolic complication in this patient?

A 70-year-old woman has been healthy except for hypertension treated with a thiazide diuretic. She presents with sudden onset of a severe, tearing chest pain, which radiates to the back and is associated with dyspnea and diaphoresis. Blood pressure is 210/94. Lung auscultation reveals bilateral basilar rales. A faint murmur of aortic insufficiency is heard. The brain-natriuretic peptide (BNP) level is elevated at 550 pg/mL (normal < 100). ECG shows nonspecific ST-T changes. Chest x-ray (CXR) suggests a widened mediastinum. Which of the following represents the best initial management?

options.label: A
options.text: IV furosemide plus IV loading dose of digoxin

options.label: B
options.text: Percutaneous coronary intervention with consideration of angioplasty and/or stenting

options.label: C
options.text: Blood cultures and rapid initiation of vancomycin plus gentamicin, followed by echocardiography

options.label: D
options.text: IV beta-blocker to control heart rate, IV nitroprusside to control blood pressure, trans esophageal echocardiogram, and emergency thoracic surgery consultation

questions.correct_answer: D. IV beta-blocker to control heart rate, IV nitroprusside to control blood pressure, trans esophageal echocardiogram, and emergency thoracic surgery consultation

questions.text: A patient has been in the coronary care unit for the past 24 hours with an acute anterior myocardial infarction. He develops the abnormal rhythm shown in the following figure, although blood pressure remains stable at 110/68. Which of the following is the best next step in therapy?

A 70-year-old man presents to the emergency department with 6 hours of substernal chest pressure, diaphoresis, and nausea. An electrocardiogram is done as shown in the figure. The patient is given 325 mg aspirin and sublingual nitroglycerin while awaiting the results of his blood work. His troponin I is 0.65 ng/mL(normal <0.04 ng/mL). The physician in the emergency department starts the patient on low-molecular-weight heparin. Blood pressure is currently 154/78 and heart rate is 72. What is the best next step in management?

options.label: C
options.text: Admit the patient to a monitored cardiac bed and repeat cardiac enzymes and ECG in 6 hours

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding valve replacement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Compared with mechanical prosthetic valves, the rate of structural deterioration of bioprosthetic valves is less

options.label: B
options.text: In the absence of atrial fibrillation, long-term anticoagulation is not needed in most patients with bioprosthetic valves

options.label: C
options.text: Antibiotic prophylaxis for dental procedures that manipulate gingival tissue is recommended for patients with mechanical but not bioprosthetic valves

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with bioprosthetic valves do not need regular follow-up

questions.correct_answer: B. In the absence of atrial fibrillation, long-term anticoagulation is not needed in most patients with bioprosthetic valves

questions.text: A 70-year-old man with a history of chronic kidney disease, diabetes mellitus, and CHF is admitted with decreased urine output, weakness, and shortness of breath. Laboratory tests are pending; his ECG is shown in the following figure. Based on the information available, what is the best initial step in management?

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of oral sodium polystyrene sulfonate

questions.correct_answer: A. Administration of intravenous calcium gluconate

questions.text: Which of the following autoantibodies is typically present in high titres in patients with mixed connective tissue disease?

A 57-year-old woman with depression and chronic migraine headaches reports several years of dry mouth and dry eyes. She has no other associated symptoms. Examination shows dry, erythematous, sticky oral mucosa. All of the following tests are likely to be positive in this patient EXCEPT:
The removal of introns and subsequent self-splicing of adjacent exons occurs in some portions of primary ribosomal RNA transcripts. The splicing of introns in messenger RNA precursors is

options.label: A
options.text: RNA-catalyzed in the absence of protein

questions.text: Denaturation of DNA is PCR is carried out by heating to a temperature of:
In HbM, histidine is replaced by:
Which among the following amino acids absorbs UV light?
Which vitamin deficiency can result in Homocystinuria?
One week infant, having classic phenylketonuria, which of the following statement is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Tyrosine is nonessential amino acid for this infant

options.label: B
options.text: High levels of phenylpyruvate is appearing in the urine

options.label: C
options.text: Therapy must begin within first year of life

options.label: D
options.text: Diet therapy should be discontinued once infant reaches adulthood.

questions.correct_answer: B. High levels of phenylpyruvate is appearing in the urine

questions.text: ‘NANA’ is formed from
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • N-Acety1 neuraminic acid is a 9 carbon sugar derived from mannosamine (6) and pyrvate (3)
  • ↳ • It is a constituent of (a) Glycoproteins (b) Glycolipid

questions.text: Which of the following is the function of the nucleosomes?

options.label: A
options.text: Package genetic material in a condensed form

options.label: C
options.text: Form pores for bilateral nuclear-to-cytoplasmic transport

questions.correct_answer: A. Package genetic material in a condensed form

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy comes to the pediatrician with an absence of signs of puberty. Physical examination reveals a normal prepubertal male in spite of his age, with no signs of secondary sexual characteristic development. The patient appears underdeveloped with little muscle mass, and his voice is high-pitched. Pubic and axillary hair is sparse, the testes are underdeveloped (volume < 4 mL), and the phallus is small. Evaluation of the first cranial nerve shows normal sense of smell. Following additional studies were done: LH: 0.6 IU/mL (normal: 0.9 to 10.6 IU/mL) Testosterone: 80 ng/dL (normal: 300-1000 ng/dL) Injection of 100 μg GnRH stimulates a lower than normal release of both FSH and LH. Which of the characteristics of pubertal development will not be corrected by treatment with exogenous testosterone?

options.label: B
options.text: Growth spurt followed by closure of the epiphyseal plates

options.label: C
options.text: Growth of facial and axillary hair

questions.correct_answer: D. Development of the mature sperm

questions.text: A 37-year-old man comes to the physician’s office complaining of chronic pain in the upper and middle back, headaches, muscle weakness in the hands, and loss of sensitivity to hot and cold temperature. Radiography of the skull and cervical spine shows thoracic scoliosis and osteoporosis. MRI reveals focal cord enlargement due to an intramedullary neoplasm. Obstruction of the spinal cord canal can cause what combination of CSF pressure changes?

A 42-year-old man comes to his primary care physician complaining of awkwardness when running or walking. The weakness began in his right leg 4 months ago, and now the left leg is beginning to show signs of weakness. During testing of the right leg for the patellar tendon stretch reflex, which of the following findings would be consistent with a diagnosis of an upper motor neuron defect?

A 68-year-old man comes to his primary care physician complaining of tiredness and difficulty in sleeping. Six months earlier, the patient experienced myocardial infarction of the anterior wall of the left ventricle. A stent was placed in the occluded coronary artery, reestablishing perfusion. The patient now complains of difficulty sleeping at night, awakening with shortness of breath. Vital signs: T 37°C, P 80/min, R 18/min and shallow, BP 100/70 mm Hg, BMI 29. Physical examination: A third heart sound is evident. Auscultation reveals crackles at the base of the lung, and there is dullness to percussion at the base of the lung. The low arterial blood pressure is likely due to decrease in which of the following?

A 67-year-old man presents to his physician complaining of sharp cramps and pains in his legs while exercising. The cramping is occurring in the calf area and occurs at any exercise intensity greater than walking at a moderate pace. He states that the pain is relieved by rest but begins again when he begins to exercise again. Contrast angiography revealed widespread arterial calcifications in the arteries below the knee. The vascular consequences of the calcifications are which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Diminished vascular resistance in the region

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased velocity of flow through the stenosis

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased volume of flow through the stenosis

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased pressure gradient across the stenosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased volume of flow through the stenosis

questions.text: A 62-year-old man comes to the clinic at a ski resort on a mountain peak (14,000 ft, barometric pressure 420 mm Hg) complaining of dyspnea, headache, dizziness, and inability to sleep. He was short of breath while climbing the stairs at the lodge and noticed that he was breathing rapidly even when sitting down. The patient arrived at the resort yesterday from a sea level town and reports no current health issues or medications. The arterial blood gas abnormality contributing to the headache is which of the following?
